analysis.Summary: Vue 3 component providing a form to display and edit task details (name, description, status, assignedTo) via v-model bindings and emit updates on field changes.
analysis.Purpose: Encapsulate the UI and logic for editing a task object in the governance module. It exposes a reactive `modelValue` prop and emits `update:modelValue` events when any field is modified.

Components.name: FormTaskDetails
responsibilities: Render a form with inputs for task fields: name, description, status, assignedTo
Bind each input to a corresponding property on the `modelValue` prop
Handle user input events and emit updated model objects

Functions.name: updateField
Functions.description: Handles updating a single field in the task model and emits the full updated object.

params.name: field
params.description: The key of the task property to update (e.g. 'name', 'status').

params.name: value
params.description: The new value for the specified field.

analysis.Usage:
Imported into parent views or pages that manage task data. Typically used with v-model syntax to bind a task object:
```html
<FormTaskDetails v-model:modelValue="currentTask" />
```
Notes: No `<style>` block is defined; styling should be provided by a global or parent stylesheet.
Uses the script setup syntax from Vue 3 Composition API for concise prop and emit definitions.
Emits the entire updated object for each field change, so parent components should handle performance considerations if the model is large.
Status field options are hardcoded; if statuses change, this component may need updates.
